recipes.title: Coq au vin
recipes.description: Delicious dish that translates to 'rooster with wine'. Cooked slowly which allows the flavors to meld together, resulting in a rich and savory dish. This version reduces the calorie content by using skinless chicken, turkey bacon and a lighter red wine. Bon app√©tit!
recipes.ingredients:
- 4 Skinless, bone-in chicken thighs
- 2 cups of low-sodium chicken broth
- 1 cup of red wine
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1 onion
- 2 cloves of garlic
- 8 ounces of mushrooms
- 4 slices of turkey bacon
- 1 tablespoon of flour
- Salt and pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned.
2. Cook the onion, garlic, mushrooms and turkey bacon until the vegetables are softened and the bacon is crispy.
3. Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir.
4. Slowly pour in the chicken broth and red wine, taking it to a simmer.
5. Add the chicken to the mixture and allow to simmer for 30-40 minutes.
6. Season with salt and pepper and serve with your choice of sides.
recipes.nutritional_value:
Calories: 450 calories approx. per portion
Fat: 25g
Carbohydrates: 13g
Protein: 37g

recipes.title: Rosti
recipes.description: Classic dish from Switzerland made from fried crispy potatoes
recipes.ingredients:
- 4 medium potatoes 
- 1 onion, chopped 
- 1 small carrot 
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned.
2. Cook the onion, garlic, mushrooms and turkey bacon until the vegetables are softened and the bacon is crispy.
3. Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir.
4. Slowly pour in the chicken broth and red wine, taking it to a simmer.
5. Add the chicken to the mixture and allow to simmer for 30-40 minutes.
6. Season with salt and pepper and serve with your choice of sides.
recipes.nutritional_value:
Calories: 450 calories approx. per portion
Fat: 25g
Carbohydrates: 13g
Protein: 37g

recipes.title: Greek Salad
recipes.description: Refresing dish from Greece known for being a combination of fresh vegetables, feta chese and olives.
recipes.ingredients:
- 2 large tomatoes 
- 1 red onion 
- 1 bell pepper 
- 1/2 cup of olives 
-1/2 cup of crumbled feta cheese 
-2 tablespoons extra virigin olive oil 
 -1 tablespoon vinegar
recipes.instructions:
1. Whisk together the olive oil and red wine vinegar , salt and pepper can also be added 
2. In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, red onion, pepper and olives 
 3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss it 
 4. Sprinkle the crumbled feta chese on top
recipes.nutritional_value:
Calories: 225 calories approx. 
Fat: 15g
Carbohydrates: 16g
Protein: 9g

reviews.comment: Easy to make and very tasty!
